dialogue_history.content:
Analyze this financial news and estimate stock price movement probabilities.
Company: Apple Inc. (AAPL)
News Headline: The Best Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy With $1,000 Right Now
News Content: Got an extra $1,000 you would like to put to work but don't quite know how? Don't make it complicated. Just poach a pick or two (or several) from one of the world's best-known and most-proven stock pickers. He's Warren Buffett, of course. There's a reason he has been able to reliably lead Berkshire Hathaway to market-beating performances.

With that as the backdrop, here's a closer look at three of Berkshire's holdings that are solid prospects for you at this time, in no particular order.

Coca-Cola

It's such a commonly suggested Buffett pick that it has almost become a cliché. Nevertheless, there's good reason Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) continues to be highlighted as a stock you might want to own, too.

Not only is its namesake cola woven into the world's cultural fabric, but its other well-known brands like Gold Peak tea, Minute Maid juice, Dasani water, and Powerade sports drinks (to name just a few) also mean this beverage behemoth always has something to sell regardless of consumers' ever-changing tastes.

That doesn't mean things are always easy. Coke shares have fallen 16% from their early September high in response to a small but alarming drop in the total amount of product sold (as measured by volume) during the company's fiscal third quarter of last year.

Operating income and net earnings fell even more during the three-month stretch, with no indication that the headwind was likely to abate during the quarter ending in December.

This is a timeless business, though, and Coke's brands seem just as timeless. You'll simply need to give this stock enough time for the company to prove it's worth the wait.

Buffett has certainly done so anyway. Berkshire began amassing its current 400 million shares in late 1998. The stock has nearly doubled in value since then, while the dividend -- perhaps the chief reason Buffett's such a fan -- has more than tripled during this time, extending an annual growth streak of 62 years.

Newcomers will be stepping in while the forward-looking dividend yield stands at just under 3.2%.

Apple

Just as much as Coca-Cola, Apple(NASDAQ: AAPL) is a frequently suggested Buffett pick. And as with Coke, that's for a good reason. Apple is another one of those timeless stalwarts with a well-deserved reputation for performance.

That's not necessarily been easy to believe of late. Revenue has been stagnant since mid-2022, while sales of its flagship iPhone (as measured by revenue as well as unit sales) have been just as stagnant for just as long.

Story Continues

AAPL revenue (TTM), data by YCharts; TTM = trailing 12 months.

Buffett and his lieutenants have also been paring back the size of Berkshire's stake in Apple of late, shedding roughly 600 million shares just since early last year. It certainly doesn't seem like a vote of confidence.

Just keep things in perspective. Berkshire Hathaway's position in Apple had grown to enormous proportions -- even by Buffett's liberal standards -- at a time when it looked like unrealized stock gains might become subject to income taxation. He may have simply been thinking strategically.

And either way, Berkshire's $70 billion stake in Apple is still its single biggest position, accounting for about one-fourth the value of all the conglomerate's total stock holdings combined.

The company may be on the cusp of significant and prolonged growth. Near the end of last year, Apple launched an AI-powered tool that is run directly from its newer devices. That is as opposed to being run in the cloud, as most similar platforms like ChatGPT or Alphabet's Gemini typically are at this time. Apple is also developing a processor chip that could power its own artificial intelligence (AI) data centers.

It's not exactly clear where or what Apple's place in the ever-changing AI arena is. But given IDC's expectation that the worldwide AI platform market will grow at an annual pace of more than 40% through 2028, the company isn't wrong to throw its hat into the ring and capture whatever growth it can.

BYD

Lastly, add BYD(OTC: BYDD.F) to your list of Warren Buffett stocks to buy with $1,000 right now. If the name doesn't ring a bell, you might be more familiar with it than you realize. The electric vehicle (EV) company has been outselling industry-leader Tesla from time to time since late 2023.

Although BYD makes other things, most of its top line comes from its affordable EVs and related products. It's also one of a small handful of foreign stocks that the typically pro-USA Buffett likes, and the only Chinese stock among Berkshire's current holdings.

This is telling in and of itself -- but not necessarily surprising in light of BYD's past and projected growth. Even in the midst of global economic lethargy (particularly in and around China), this company's top line is expected to grow by 24% for the entirety of 2024, followed by revenue growth of nearly 21% for the fiscal year now underway.

This pace of growth could persist for a long, long while, too. Although U.S. consumers' euphoria regarding EVs is cooling, actual global demand is still growing and is likely to continue doing so.

BloombergNEF, which tracks the lower-carbon economy, predicts total worldwide sales of EVs are going to nearly double their current levels by 2027, reaching 30 million units, en route to annual sales of 73 million in 2040. As BYD ventures further and further outside of its home turf during this stretch (perhaps eventually including the United States?), look for it to capture at least its fair share of this growth.

And don't worry about BYD's over-the-counter listing (as opposed to a more conventional listing on an exchange). With a $100 billion market capitalization, it's not your usual OTC stock.

Securing U.S. exchange-based stock listings can be a logistical hassle as well as needlessly costly for many foreign companies. It's certainly not a problem for Buffett and Berkshire, which presently hold nearly $2 billion worth of this over-the-counter ticker.

Don’t miss this second chance at a potentially lucrative opportunity

Ever feel like you missed the boat in buying the most successful stocks? Then you’ll want to hear this.

On rare occasions, our expert team of analysts issues a “Double Down” stock recommendation for companies that they think are about to pop. If you’re worried you’ve already missed your chance to invest, now is the best time to buy before it’s too late. And the numbers speak for themselves:

Nvidia:if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2009,you’d have $341,656!* Apple: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2008, you’d have $44,179!* Netflix: if you invested $1,000 when we doubled down in 2004, you’d have $446,749!*

Right now, we’re issuing “Double Down” alerts for three incredible companies, and there may not be another chance like this anytime soon.

See 3 “Double Down” stocks »

*Stock Advisor returns as of January 13, 2025

Suzanne Frey, an executive at Alphabet, is a member of The Motley Fool's board of directors. James Brumley has positions in Alphabet and Coca-Cola. The Motley Fool has positions in and recommends Alphabet, Apple, Berkshire Hathaway, and Tesla. The Motley Fool recommends BYD Company. The Motley Fool has a disclosure policy.

The Best Warren Buffett Stocks to Buy With $1,000 Right Now was originally published by The Motley Fool

View Comments

Also note that there are multiple rounds of precitions, demonstrating the trend of others' beliefs.
Please take these information into consideration when prediction the stock price movement probabilities.

Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple's position as a strong investment choice alongside other Buffett picks, suggesting confidence in its long-term potential. However, it also notes recent stagnation in revenue and a reduction in Berkshire's stake, which could indicate some caution among investors. The mention of Apple's foray into AI could be a positive catalyst for future growth, but the current market sentiment may be mixed due to the recent performance. Overall, the probabilities reflect a slight edge towards a price rise due to the positive framing of Apple as a Buffett stock, balanced by concerns over recent performance.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The article highlights Apple as a Warren Buffett pick, emphasizing its 'timeless stalwart' status. While revenue has been stagnant and Berkshire has reduced its stake, the article suggests strategic reasons for the stake reduction and highlights Apple's significant investment in AI, a rapidly growing market. The article also mentions that Berkshire Hathaway's position in Apple is still its single biggest position, accounting for about one-fourth the value of all the conglomerate's total stock holdings combined. This positive sentiment, coupled with the AI initiatives, suggests a slightly higher probability of a stock price rise. However, the stagnant revenue and stake reduction temper the optimism, leading to a more balanced probability assessment.

However, the article also notes that Berkshire Hathaway has been reducing its Apple stake recently, which could be interpreted as a lack of confidence.  While Apple's foray into AI is mentioned as a potential growth driver, the overall tone regarding Apple's recent performance is mixed (stagnant revenue and iPhone sales).  The mention of Buffett's investment is positive, but the reduction in Berkshire's holdings introduces uncertainty. Therefore, the probability of a price rise is considered moderate, while the probability of a fall is relatively low, reflecting the overall mixed signals in the news.

(AAPL) as a solid investment choice, referencing its timeless reputation and potential growth in the AI sector. However, it also notes stagnant revenue and iPhone sales, along with Berkshire Hathaway reducing its stake. The launch of AI-powered tools and development of AI chips could be positive catalysts, but the market's reaction may be mixed due to recent performance concerns. Overall, the positive aspects (AI growth potential, strong brand) slightly outweigh the negatives (revenue stagnation, Berkshire's reduced stake).

(AAPL) and mentions that despite recent stagnant revenue and iPhone sales, Apple is a timeless stalwart with a well-deserved reputation for performance. The article highlights Apple's potential for significant and prolonged growth, especially with its foray into AI and development of a processor chip for its data centers. Additionally, it notes that Berkshire Hathaway still holds a significant stake in Apple, suggesting confidence in the company's future prospects.
Model: meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.65, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.35, Reasoning: The news article discusses Warren Buffett's stock picks, including Apple Inc. (AAPL), and provides an analysis of the company's current situation. Although Apple's revenue has been stagnant since mid-2022, and sales of its flagship iPhone have been stagnant for just as long, the company is on the cusp of significant and prolonged growth with its AI-powered tool and processor chip development. Additionally, Berkshire Hathaway's $70 billion stake in Apple is still its single biggest position, accounting for about one-fourth of the conglomerate's total stock holdings combined. Considering these factors, the probability of the stock price rising is higher than the probability of it falling.
Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.5, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.5, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple as a stock often recommended by Warren Buffett, emphasizing its timeless nature and potential future growth, particularly in AI and electric vehicles. However, it also mentions recent stagnation in revenue and sales, as well as Berkshire Hathaway's reduced stake. This mixed sentiment suggests a cautious outlook.
Round: 1
Model: openai/gpt-4o-mini, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.58, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.42, Reasoning: The news highlights Apple Inc. as a strong investment choice, often associated with Warren Buffett, which generally instills confidence among investors. However, it also points out recent stagnation in revenue and a reduction in Berkshire Hathaway's stake, which could indicate some caution. The mention of Apple's initiatives in AI presents a potential growth opportunity, but the mixed signals from recent performance temper the overall optimism. Considering these factors, I estimate a slightly higher probability of a stock price rise due to the positive framing and potential for future growth, balanced against the concerns raised.
Model: google/gemini-2.0-flash-001, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.53, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.47, Reasoning: The consensus from the previous round leans towards a slightly positive outlook for Apple (AAPL), primarily due to its association with Warren Buffett and its potential in the AI sector. However, concerns remain regarding stagnant revenue and Berkshire Hathaway's reduced stake. The news article presents a mixed picture, highlighting both opportunities and challenges. Considering the previous predictions and the inherent uncertainties, I'll adjust the probabilities slightly to reflect a more balanced view, acknowledging the potential for both upward and downward movement.
Model: google/gemini-flash-1.5, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news piece presents a mixed outlook for Apple. While it highlights Apple as a Warren Buffett pick, emphasizing its long-term potential and the significant investment in AI, it also acknowledges recent revenue stagnation and Berkshire Hathaway's reduction of its stake.  The AI initiatives are a potential positive catalyst, but the uncertainty surrounding their impact and the recent performance concerns create a balanced outlook.  The previous predictions range from 0.5 to 0.65 for a price rise, reflecting this ambiguity. Considering the mixed signals and the lack of overwhelmingly positive or negative news, I'm assigning probabilities closer to even odds, slightly favoring a rise due to the long-term potential and the continued significant investment by Berkshire Hathaway, albeit a reduced one.
Model: deepseek/deepseek-chat-v3-0324, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The news article presents a mixed view of Apple Inc. (AAPL), highlighting its status as a Warren Buffett stock and its potential for growth in the AI sector, which could be positive for the stock price. However, it also notes stagnant revenue and iPhone sales, as well as Berkshire Hathaway reducing its stake, which may weigh on investor sentiment. The overall tone leans slightly positive due to the potential AI growth, but the negative aspects cannot be ignored. Considering the previous predictions, which mostly favor a slight rise, and the mixed nature of the news, the probabilities are balanced.

(AAPL) as one of Warren Buffett's top picks, highlighting its strong brand and potential for growth in AI. However, it also mentions stagnant revenue and iPhone sales, as well as Berkshire Hathaway's recent reduction in its stake. Model: qwen/qwen-turbo, Prediction of stock price rising: 0.55, Prediction of stock price falling: 0.45, Reasoning: The financial news highlights Apple as one of Warren Buffett's picks, emphasizing its strong brand and potential growth, especially in the AI sector. Despite mentioning recent stagnation in revenue and iPhone sales, as well as Berkshire Hathaway's reduced stake, the overall context frames Apple as a reliable long-term investment.
